Package javelin.model.world.location.dungeon

Class DungeonZoner

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.DungeonZoner
  • public class DungeonZoner
extends java.lang.Object
    Helps place Features in Dungeons more smartly than a random naive approach. Mostly takes into consideraton Doors to divide the map into DungeonZoner.Zones - assuming that the dungeon population would choose to secure their goods, naturally-ocurring features, access to lower levels, etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  DungeonZoner.Zone
      A Dungeon might be comprised of one or more zones, with frontiers represented by doors.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • DungeonZoner

        public DungeonZoner​(Dungeon d,
                    Point entrance)
        Parameters:
        d - Expects a mostly-setup Dungeon (with Doors, stairs, walls, etc), ready to be scanned.

    • Method Detail

      • getpoint

        public Point getpoint()
        Returns:
        A random point in the dungeon, with points in a deeper DungeonZoner.Zone being exponentially more likely to be chosen. Does not take into account dungeon size - so a shallow DungeonZoner.Zone that is very big will have more chance to be represented than a deep DungeonZoner.Zone that is very small.

      • place

        public void place​(Feature f)
